text.text: How can I move a single claim to State Collections ?

text: To move a single claim to State Collections, you can use the Claim page. To get to the Claim page, enter the claim number in search and then select the number from the Search Results list. If the patient is the payer, click the Credits tab and then click Move to collections. On the Move to collections window, click State debt collections.

text.text: What steps do I follow to access the Claim page for moving a claim to State Collections?

text: To access the Claim page, you can enter the claim number in search and then select the number from the Search Results list. If the patient is the payer, click the Credits tab and then click Move to collections. On the Move to collections window, click State debt collections.

text.text: Where do I find the option to move a claim to collections on the Claim page?

text: To move a claim to collections, you can click the Credits tab and then click Move to collections. On the Move to collections window, click State debt collections.

text.text: When moving a claim to collections, what options are available under the "Move to collections" window?

text: When moving a claim to collections, you can click the state filed to pick a state. You can also click the Credits tab and then click Move to collections. On the Move to collections window, you can click State debt collections.

text.text: How do I specify the state when moving a claim to State Collections?

text: To specify the state when moving a claim to State Collections, you can click the state filed to pick a state.

text.text: What happens to the claim's status after moving it to State Collections?

text: When you move a claim to State Collections, the status for all claims in the account with the patient as the current payer changes to "Suspended - In state debt collections".

text.text: Can I remove an account from state collections even after receiving payments from the state? If so, how?

text: Yes, you can remove an account from state collections even if you have received payments from the state. To remove the suspension, click "Send another statement". This action removes the account from the list on the "Final statement sent" tab and changes the status on the claims associated with the account to "Queued for submission - Patient statement".

text.text: Where do I find the option to remove a claim from state collections?

text: To remove a claim from state collections, you can click the reverse icon next to the amount in collections.

text.text: What action do I take to initiate the removal of a claim from state collections?

text: To remove a claim from state collections, you can click the "Remove from state debt" button on the confirmation window. This will return the claim to patient responsibility, where you can bill the patient, write off the amount, etc.
I missed that, say that again?

text.text: How does the system confirm the removal of a claim from state collections?

text: The system will confirm the removal of a claim from state collections by showing a message that the accounts have been moved.

text.text: After removing a claim from state collections, what is the status of the claim?

text: The status of the claim is suspended (not closed). This means you don't have to write anything off your books after performing this action. If the state collects from the patient, you can post the payment because the state is added as the final payer on the claim level COB.

text.text: What options do I have once the claim is back to patient responsibility after removal from state collections?

text: Once the claim is back to patient responsibility, you have the ability to: bill the patient, write-off the amount, etc

text.text: How can I bill the patient once the claim is back to patient responsibility?

text: You can bill the patient by using the "Suspend patient billing" button.

text.text: Is it possible to write-off the amount after removing a claim from state collections? If yes, how?

text: Yes, it is possible to write-off the amount after removing a claim from state collections. To do this, you can click the "Remove from state debt" button on the confirmation window.

text.text: What changes in payment responsibility occur after removing a claim from state collections?

text: When you remove a claim from state collections, the status changes to "Suspended - In state debt collections". The status is suspended (not closed) which means you don't have to write anything off your books after performing this action. If the state collects from the patient, you can post the payment because the state is added as the final payer on the claim level COB.

text.text: how can i add a claim?

text: To manually create a claim, you can use the following steps: 1. Click Create Claims 2. Click Import File 3. Click Next 4. Enter the information you want to include in the claim 5. Click Next 6. The system builds the claim using the information you provided.

text.text: how do i remove a claim?

text: To remove a claim from a facility invoice, you can click the "Remove from facility invoice" button. The system will ask if you are sure you want to delete the claim from the facility invoice. If you click Yes, the claim's status will change to "Suspended – Verify COB".

text.text: how to remove a claim from state collection?

text: To remove a claim from state collections, you can click the "Remove from state debt" button on the confirmation window. The claim will be back to patient responsibility where you can bill the patient, write off the amount, etc.
